oai_dc:dc.dc:title: HYDRODYNAMIC FORCES ON NEAR-BED UNDERWATER DATACENTER
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hu, Xiaoyuan
Teng, Yunfei
Cheng, Liang
Tong, Feifei
An, Hongwei
Draper, Scott
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Compare with the flow past a sphere and finite-length cylinders, flow around a short cylinder with hemisphere ends has not been studied extensively. As a transition variant of sphere and finite-length cylinder, it is ubiquitous in engineering, e.g. submarine-like shape[1] and underwater datacenter (UDC)[2, 3]. There are few works focusing on hydrodynamic forces on a near-bed short cylinder with hemisphere ends, despite of its wide range of engineering applications.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; management.100
